alert.note: Alert for Butte; Glenn (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 9:13PM PDT until further notice by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Sacramento CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River Below Red Bluff Diversion Dam affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River Above Bend Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River Near Hamilton City affecting Butte and Glenn Counties. .Heavy rainfall over the past 24 hours is producing significant rises on the upper Sacramento river system. For the Upper Sacramento River...including Bend Bridge, Red Bluff Diversion Dam, Tehama Bridge, Vina Woodson Bridge, Hamilton City, Ord Ferry, Butte City, Moulton Weir, Colusa Weir, Colusa Bridge, Tisdale Weir...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sacramento River near Hamilton City. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 147.2 feet, Overflow begins on the east bank of the river, from near Wilson Landing Road to Highway 32. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 141.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 147.9 feet tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 147.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 147.9 feet on 02/27/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued later tonight.Wednesday evening at 645 PM PDT.
